conclusion: Analyze the paths of the liquid from points A, B, and C to determine which container it will flow into.
Liquid flows downward from A, passing through the white baffle and heading towards the left side.
Liquid flows downward from B, passing through the yellow baffle and heading towards the center.
Liquid flows downward from C, passing through the blue baffle and heading towards the right side.
White baffle directs flow to the left.
Yellow baffle directs flow to the center.
Blue baffle directs flow to the right.
Liquid from A flows left and will reach container D.
Liquid from B flows to the center and will reach container E.
Liquid from C flows to the right and will reach container F.
Liquid from A, B, and C will flow into containers D, E, and F respectively.
